result.execSummary:
The defendant David M VanPay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David M VanPay is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David M VanPay was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $350 fine plus costs, including Court-appointed attorney fees. 60 days to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M VanPay

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David M VanPay in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Prior: 1911 Huron Street, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant David M VanPay in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that he needs additional time to review gun rights.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David M VanPay in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that case is close to being resolved, has to confirm implication of read-in on gun rights.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David M VanPay in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense enters not guilty pleas, requests status conference. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
from Defense requesting status conference in 30-60 days.
Court appoints Brett Reetz, orders Defendant to pay $125 per month starting 5/1/15.

Defendant David M VanPay in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant has presented Petition for Court-appointed Counsel. Court advises Defendant of process, advises Defendant to contact PD's office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
